pros: Kettering Staff and Faculty are all great people. We care about our students and work very hard to ensure they have a great experience. Many different opportunities to get involved in the Kettering community. The new building "Learning Commons". Benefits are great!
cons: Depending on your role, the pay can be lower than competitors.

pros: Great time off and flexibility
cons: Compensation is not competitive to market

pros: good learning environment to learn
cons: heavy working load of teaching

pros: Everyone here is very passionate and thoughtful. There’s a lot of transparency about everything, even finances. Most people have been here for a while. There’s a lot of stability. The institution is taking strides to improve in lots of ways, including employee satisfaction.
cons: Limited upward mobility. Very low salaries compared to similar institutions, especially for lower level positions. Understaffed in *every* department. Be prepared to do the work of three people and still be underpaid.

pros: Amazing learning experience along with university
cons: Can get hectic sometimes if the work load is too much

pros: good pay, coworkers are nice people
cons: Not flexible work hours, need benefits

pros:
Most coworkers 
Easy work
Food
cons:
Pay
Supervisors
Nurses
Doctors
Administration

pros: I like working for Kettering. The work is satisfactory and great coworkers.
cons: The biggest downside is the turnover. These past two years have been hard on many of us, a lot of coworkers left. Raises haven't happened in three years for most, despite many taking on multiple roles after departures. Senior leadership is out of touch.

pros: Supportive colleagues make this a rewarding workplace.
cons: There could be more info coming from the administration.

pros: Some silo areas are great
cons: They will not pay you a lot of money

pros: Good to earn money as a student
cons: Hard to balance with school

pros: Living Expenses can be met.
cons: Too little for all the necessities.

pros: -Great learning opportunity, - Individual Support and Guidance
cons: - Research Infrastructure could be improved

pros: As the former GMI  the school is in the top ten for engineering and known world wide.  The benefit package is great.  Allotted time off is another perk.
cons: Wages are poor and way below national average for position.  Too  much micromanaging by upper management. Those who work and dedicate themselves to the institute are not rewarded.  Very poor communication and leadership.  Those who don't work to their potential are not disciplined.  No follow though with upper management with issues or concerns.

review_title: Family atmosphere, wonderful community of people
pros: Small campus - you get to know everyone just like family, including the students. Some of the perks are great, such as the rec center - and having access to use it
cons: Just like family - there's usually a bad seed. Low pay, very little advancement. New administration is making changes frequently and creating a very unsettled work environment. Location - Flint, MI.

pros: Generally the people that work their are great. If there is a project you want to do, you typically are allowed to do it.
cons: Morale is unusually low and sometimes work loads become unreasonable so things get put off until someone higher up panics and request them to get done. Resources to get things done are low. Pay is below average.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Flint, MI
pros: Paid for my graduate classes. Opportunity to grow & change in teaching methods as time went on.
cons:
Not much supervision and communication between class professors & me teaching labs so material being covered would not also match up week to week between class & labs. 

Also very low pay. Barely enough for housing & food.

review_title: Best place to work in East Michigan
pros: Visionary Leadership, Fantastic President, great atmosphere and opportunities. This place is about taking it to the next level.  STEM is where the jobs are and Kettering is training the next great leaders.
cons: Wish there were more food options on campus

pros: Good international MBA program respecting cultural needs
cons: I have no negative comments except that I couldn’t continue an ongoing relationship as an adjunct professor, and only taught one semester.

review_title: Have not given pay raises in the past 8 years
job_title: Director of Facilities Management in Flint, MI
pros: Great working with the students
cons: It is a Private University, so any increased funding (tuition) is not used for salaries.  Have laid off in both 2010 and 2012

review_title: A great place to work! Great work environment!
job_title: Lead, User Experience Design in Flint, MI
pros: Great benefits and work environment. Opportunities for online training with Lynda.com and you are encouraged to try new things.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: Love working at the Recreation Center
pros: Consistent hours, easy to get substitutes if you know you can't make your shift, flexible if you are very sick and can't make your shift.
cons: Don't always get enough hours or the hours I want.

pros: I loved working here. As a graduate assistant I was given the utmost exposure where I had a chance to meet the Alums and even work with one of them
cons: I have nothing to complain

review_title: This is a part-time and competitive job
pros: You will learn a lot at its labs and be prepared for getting a good job after graduation
cons: You should be match with your supervisor.

pros: Great place to work. The Techworks Business Incubator was a great place to volunteer and work.
cons: None. The work was important, and had a great impact on the area business environment.

pros: some flexibility with hours, management allows employees to take lead on projects, management will promote based on merit
cons: low salary, pressured sales environment, not a lot of room to move up

pros: Great place to learn and start a career. Friendly co-workers and an amazing President.
cons: Located in Flint, MI, frequent changes to structure make knowing duties difficult.

pros: very good University for Automotive Research  .
cons: Should Provide an opportunity for F1 (International Students )  to work on Co-op(Internship).

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Flint, MI
pros: Good experience and good pay
cons: A little hectic. Sometimes you are faced with difficult tasks.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Flint, MI
pros: Empowerment, Flexibility, Growth, Selfstarter, Vision
cons: Subjective Testing courses are Needed

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Flint, MI
pros: People are very cooperative. Help you if you don't know anything.
cons: None I can think of.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Flint, MI
pros: Because it is a small university you have enough opportunities to explore
cons: Resources can be improved further.

pros: Great place, Healthy work culture
cons: Nothing as to say, more funds will benefit more grad students

review_title: Great place to learn new things.
pros: Encouraging professors, Lots of Opportunities.
cons: Less number of courses for Graduate students.

pros: Place with full of work
cons: No cons related to my work

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Flint, MI
pros: Fun work environment, constantly learning
cons: work lots of unpaid overtime
